revised_title: Kinetic Analysis of Sodium Gating Current in Squid Giant Axon
tldr: The authors conducted a critical study of the kinetic components of the sodium gating current in the squid giant axon, resolving at least five distinguishable components. They found a very fast component with a relaxation time constant of around 100 microseconds and a charge transfer of about 1. The main part of the current relaxed more slowly, with a time constant similar to the inactivation of sodium channels. The study provides valuable information about the kinetics of the steps that precede and follow the normal opening of the channel.
